page.title: 12ECOLOGY The Essendon Society
page.content: { The Essendon Society is to protect and preserve Essendon village. It was started in 1971 when a lady built a garage in the middle of the village. People thought it spoilt the view and got together to form the Essendon Society. They meet about once every six weeks in each others houses. With urgent matters a special meeting is called. The secretary keeps a record of everything discussed at the meetings in a minute book. Anybody can join and the cost is 25p for each household. The Society collects old photos of the area and has planted trees in the village. In 1985 they were fighting a proposed extension to the gypsy site at Holwell.The gypsies think the newcomers will take away their jobs and they would prefer the site to stay at its present size.
